description.narrative: Cambodian Food and Service Workers’ Federation (CFSWF) is an independent federation of food and service industries in Cambodia. It founded on December 2, 2007. CFSWF’s mission is to promote workers’ rights and interests by empowering workers through awareness raising, organizing and advocacy. CFSWF organizes workers in food and beverage, and entertainment industries. Workers in these sectors face many problems such as severe working condition, the absence of social protection include labour and union rights. They only paid $40-150 USD per month and worked more than 8 hours per day. Women working in entertainment industry face social discrimination from their families and society. The project aims to empower workers to claim and protect their social, economic, and political rights for equality and justice. Project objectives are as the following; -          To empower working people/union member to claim their right and justice -          CFSWF advocates for better working condition and prevention from exploitation for workers include working accident, sexual harassment and violation. -          To improve gender justice for rights of women/men in society. -          To encourage young working people participantion in union agenda and social activities -          To improve CFSWF organizational capacity and internal democracy Expected results: -          Numbers of local union group will be formed and empowered to claim their rights for improving their working condition and improve gender justic for men and women. -          Working accident, sexual harassment and violation will be reduced and prevented -          Young workers will be more participated in the union agenda and social activities. -          Organizational capacity and internal democracy will be improved and transparency. The project focuses on improving and promoting right of female and young workers in Food and Service sector. CFSWF operates in Phnom Penh, Siem Reap and Sihanouk vile.
This project mainly contributes to results within Decent work and fair income. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
